byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting from Washington, and Declan Walsh from London.

lead_paragraph: Nearly two years before Mr. Weinstein was killed in an American drone strike, the F.B.I. advised his family about paying $250,000 to the militants holding him, officials said.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Said to Give Hostage’s Family Ransom Advice
headline.main: U.S. Said to Give Warren Weinstein’s Family Ransom Advice

snippet: Nearly two years before Mr. Weinstein was killed in an American drone strike, the F.B.I. advised his family about paying $250,000 to the militants holding him, officials said.
abstract: United States officials confirm that FBI advised family of Warren Weinstein, aid worker kidnapped by Al Qaeda, about paying ransom to militants two years before he was inadvertently killed in American drone strike; add that guidance offered did not conflict with US anti-ransom policy.
